instructions.instruction: Prepare tools: PZ2 & flathead screwdrivers, brush, wooden skewer/shims, vacuum, cloths.
Safety first: Unplug the grinder from the wall outlet.
Remove the grounds catch cup and its lid.
Pull off the front magnetic faceplate.
Unscrew the four screws on the dial assembly using a PZ2 screwdriver.
Remove the dial assembly. Set screws aside safely.
Carefully remove the small metal retaining clip from the burr shaft. Set it aside.
Use wooden shims or skewers to gently pry out the outer burr assembly.
Remove the spring from behind the outer burr. Set it aside.
Scrape coffee grounds from the grinder chamber and screw holes using a wooden tool.
Thoroughly vacuum the inside of the grinder chamber.
Wash the outer burr assembly with a brush and soapy water. Rinse and dry completely.
Wash the grounds catch cup and lid with soapy water. Rinse and dry completely.
Wipe the inside of the grinder chamber with a damp sponge. Dry thoroughly.
Wipe the exterior of the grinder body with a cloth.
Place the spring back into the grinder chamber.
Insert the dried outer burr assembly back into the grinder, ensuring proper seating.
Reinstall the small metal retaining clip onto the burr shaft.
Place the dial assembly back on. Align its keyway with the burr shaft.
Re-insert the four screws. Tighten gradually and evenly in a crisscross pattern.
Snap the magnetic faceplate back onto the front of the grinder.
Replace the dried grounds catch cup and its lid onto the grinder.
Plug the grinder back in and turn it on to test.
